author: Staff Reporter
text:
Collector Sajjansingh R. Chavan giving away gold coin and marriage assistance under Thalikku Thangam scheme in Nagercoil on Thursday.

Collector Sajjansingh R. Chavan distributed gold for ‘mangalasutra’ under ‘Thalikku Thangam’ scheme meant for poor educated women and marriage assistance to 222 beneficiaries in the presence of former Minister N. Thalavai Sundaram at the Collectorate here on Thursday.

Apart from four grams of gold, each beneficiary was given monetary assistance of Rs. 25,000 (for those who had passed SSLC or Plus Two), and Rs. 50,000 (for graduates).

Of the 222 beneficiaries who received the assistance of Rs.81.5 lakh in cash and 888 grams of gold, 118 were graduates and 104 had passed SSLC.

Under this scheme, 20.20 kilograms of gold and Rs. 17.22 crore assistance were distributed to beneficiaries in Kanyakumari district during 2011-12.

During 2012-13, Rs. 21.34 crore and 24.75 kg of gold were distributed.

A total of Rs. 22.50 crore and 24.58 kg of gold were given to beneficiaries in 2013-14.

So far 15,265 non graduate women have been given Rs. 38.16 crore and 12,486 graduates given Rs. 62.40 crore as marriage assistance and 111 kg of gold for mangalsutra was distributed during the last five years.

Tamil Nadu Minorities Commission Member A. Justin Selvaraj, District Social Welfare Officer K. Uma Maheshwari , District Panchayat Chairman M.S. Sarathamani were also present.
title: 222 women get gold and cash
